World History.name: Echoes of the Roaring Twenties
World History.description: Delve into the tumultuous era of the Great Depression and the cultural shifts of the 20th century. This quiz explores key events and figures that shaped America's past, from presidential legacies to iconic moments in American history.

questions.text: In what year did the Great Depression begin?
What U.S. president is mentioned by name in the opening theme song of TV's 'All in the Family'?
The American patriot Paul Revere was named for his father, whose original name was what?
How many states were in the Confederate States of America?
During which war did US troops fight the Battle of New Orleans?

World History.name: Westward Expansion Chronicles
World History.description: Journey across the American frontier with this quiz focusing on exploration, settlement, and the challenges faced by pioneers. Discover the stories behind Lewis and Clark, the significance of early American settlements, and the shaping of a nation.

questions.text: Where did Lewis and Clark begin their famous expedition in 1804?
Which of these is about the Watergate scandal?
What is the oldest permanent European settlement in the United States?

World History.name: Rebellion and Reform
World History.description: Explore the struggles for freedom and equality in American history. This quiz examines pivotal moments of resistance, from slave insurrections to political upheaval, and the individuals who fought for change.

questions.text: Who led the 1831 slave insurrection in Southampton, Virginia?
Who or what was Big Bertha?
In the presidential election of 1932, how many U.S. states did FDR not win the electoral votes for?

World History.name: Stars, Stripes, and Scandals
World History.description: Test your knowledge of American history with this quiz covering iconic moments, political controversies, and cultural shifts. From the Vietnam War protests to the creation of the national anthem, explore the defining events that shaped the nation.

questions.text: Who were the Chicago Seven?

In what decade was the Hula-Hoop invented?
